Quote: If I have been of service, if I have glimpsed more of the nature and essence of ultimate good, if I am inspired to reach wider horizons of thought and action, if I am at peace with myself, it has been a successful day.
Author: Alex Noble

Quote: Goals. There's not telling what you can do when you get inspired by them. There's no telling what you can do when you believe in them. There's no telling what will happen when you act upon them.
Author: Jim Rohn entrepreneur, author, motivational speaker

Quote: Live life fully while you're here. Experience everything. Take care of yourself and your friends. Have fun, be crazy, be weird. Go out and screw up! You're going to anyway, so you might as well enjoy the process. Take the opportunity to learn from your mistakes: find the cause of your problem and eliminate it. Don't try to be perfect; just be an excellent example of being human.
Author: Tony Robbins self-help writer, speaker

Quote: Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody else expects of you, never excuse yourself.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher clergyman, social reformer

Quote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
Author: Laozi Chinese philosopher, Central figure in Taoism

Quote: Laugh at yourself, but don't ever aim your doubt at yourself. Be bold. When you embark for strange places, don't leave any of yourself safely on shore. Have the nerve to go into unexplored territory.
Author: Alan Alda actor, director, screenwriter

Quote: Confidence...thrives on honesty, on honor, on the sacredness of obligations, on faithful protection and on unselfish performance. Without them it cannot live.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt 32nd U.S. President

Quote: The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: When your values are clear to you, making decisions becomes easier.
Author: Roy Disney Former Disney executive, nephew of Walt Disney

Quote: Respect your fellow human being, treat them fairly, disagree with them honestly, enjoy their friendship, explore your thoughts about one another candidly, work together for a common goal and help one another achieve it.
Author: Bill Bradley American hall of fame basketball player, Rhodes scholar

Quote: Respect is love in plain clothes.
Author: Frank Byrnes Former Irish radio host

Quote: Dream your dream. Follow your heart. Imagine. Listen to the wind. Drink sunsets. Be free. Let the wonder never cease. Believe. Wish on EVERY star. Create adventure. Be Kind.
Author: Debbie Coulter

Quote: Sense shines with a double luster when it is set in humility. An able and yet humble man is a jewel worth a kingdom.
Author: William Penn founder of Pennsylvania, United States

Quote: Start where you are. Distant fields always look greener, but opportunity lies right where you are. Take advantage of every opportunity of service.
Author: Robert J. Collier writer

Quote: I have three precious things which I hold fast and prize. The first is gentleness; the second frugality; the third is humility, which keeps me from putting myself before others. Be gentle and you can be bold; be frugal and you can be liberal; avoid putting yourself before others and you can become a leader among men.
Author: Laozi Chinese philosopher, Central figure in Taoism

Quote: Humility leads to strength and not to weakness. It is the highest form of self-respect to admit mistakes and to make amends for them.
Author: John J. McCloy Lawyer, banker

Quote: You are here for a purpose. There is no duplicate of you in the whole wide world. There never has been, there never will be. You were brought here now to fill a certain need. Take time to think that over.
Author: Lou Austin Author

Quote: Reach high, for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep, for every dream precedes the goal.
Author: Pamela Vaull Starr

Quote: It was character that got us out of bed, commitment that moved us into action, and discipline that enabled us to follow through.
Author: Zig Ziglar motivational author, speaker

Quote: When work, commitment, and pleasure all become one and you reach that deep well where passion lives, nothing is impossible.
Author: Nancy Coey Motivational speaker

Quote: Love yourself, accept yourself, forgive yourself, and be good to yourself, because without you the rest of us are without a source of many wonderful things.
Author: Dr. Leo Buscaglia professor, author

Quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
Author: G. K. Chesterton writer, poet, essayist, novelist

Quote: Dedicate some of your life to others. Your dedication will not be a sacrifice. It will be an exhilarating experience because it is an intense effort applied toward a meaningful end.
Author: Dr. Thomas Dooley US Navy Physician

Quote: No steam or gas drives anything until it is confined. No life ever grows great until it is focused, dedicated, disciplined.
Author: Harry Emerson Fosdick clergyman

Quote: A great attitude does much more than turn on the lights in our worlds; it seems to magically connect us to all sorts of serendipitous opportunities that were somehow absent before the change.
Author: Earl Nightingale entrepreneur, motivational author

Quote: Life means to have something definite to do\u2014a mission to fulfilled\u2014and in the measure in which we avoid setting our life to something, we make it empty. Human life, by its very nature, has to be dedicated to something.
Author: Jose Ortega y Gasset philosopher

Quote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms: it means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
Author: G. K. Chesterton writer, poet, essayist, novelist

Quote: Character is the total of thousands of small daily strivings to live up to the best that is in us.
Author: A. G. Trudeau Former US Army General

Quote: All doors open to courtesy.\n
Author: Dr. Thomas Fuller clergyman, writer

Quote: There will always be a frontier where there is an open mind and a willing hand.
Author: Charles F. Kettering Inventor, engineer

Quote: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great. Weak men wait for opportunities; strong men make them.
Author: Orison Swett Marden author, publisher

Quote: Parents, teach your children to express themselves. Teach them to be in touch with their emotions, to speak honestly to people, and to maintain integrity and stick by their principles in all they do. This is perhaps the highest morality you can instill.
Author: Jeffery Bryant

Quote: Our character...is an omen of our destiny, and the more integrity we have and keep, the simpler and nobler that destiny is likely to be.
Author: George Santayana philosopher, poet, essayist, novelist

Quote: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
Author: Washington Irving author

Quote: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.
Author: Les Brown Motivational speaker

Quote: There is something more - the spirit, or the soul. I think that that quality encourages our courtesy and care and our minds. And mercy, and identity.
Author: Maya Angelou Poet, dancer, producer, playwright, director, author

Quote: I cannot lead you into battle. I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else - I can give my heart and my devotion to these old islands and to all the peoples of our brotherhood of nations.\n
Author: Queen Elizabeth II Queen of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms

Quote: Above all be of single aim; have a legitimate and useful purpose, and devote yourself unreservedly to it.
Author: James Allen writer

Quote: Therefore hold to the things which are reliable. Look to simplicity; embrace purity; Lessen the self; diminish desire.
Author: Laozi Chinese philosopher, Central figure in Taoism

Quote: The average person puts only 25% of his energy into his work. The world takes off its hat to those who put in more than 50% of their capacity, and stands on its head for those few and far between souls who devote 100%.
Author: Andrew Carnegie Industrialist, businessman, philanthropist

Quote: When spider webs unite they can tie up a lion.
Author: African Proverb

Quote: Take control of your destiny. Believe in yourself. Ignore those who try to discourage you. Avoid negative sources, people, places, things and habits. Don't give up and don't give in.
Author: Wanda Hope Carter Motivational speaker, writer

Quote: When there is no enemy within, the enemies outside cannot hurt you.
Author: African Proverb

Quote: A mind is a fire to be kindled, not a vessel to be filled.
Author: Plutarch historian, writer

Quote: To be good is noble, but to teach others how to be good is nobler--and less trouble.
Author: Mark Twain [Samuel Clemens] humorist, essayist, novelist

Quote: Example has more followers than reason.
Author: Christian Nestell Bovee author, lawyer

Quote: By sharing something, I realized that I'm not alone, that there are a lot of people that share with me the same preoccupations, the same ideas, the same ideals, and the same quest for a meaning for this life.
Author: Paulo Coelho poet, writer

Quote: What ever beauty may be, it has for its basis order, and for its essence unity.
Author: Father Andre

Quote: When you have a sense of your own identity and a vision of where you want to go in your life, you then have the basis for reaching out to the world and going after your dreams for a better life.
Author: Stedman Graham Speaker, author, businessman

Quote: Within sorrow is grace. When we come close to those things that break us down, we touch those things that also break us open. And in that breaking open, we uncover our true nature.
Author: Wayne Muller Author, therapist, minister

Quote: Gracefulness has been defined to be the outward expression of the inward harmony of the soul.
Author: William Hazlitt essayist, literary critic

Quote: If one dream should fall and break into a thousand pieces, never be afraid to pick one of those pieces up and begin again.
Author: Flavia Weedn Author, artist

Quote: Dreams come in a size too big so that we may grow into them.
Author: Josie Bisset Television actress

Quote: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
Author: Frank Tyger

Quote: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
Author: Ashley Smith Author, speaker

Quote: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
Author: Pope John XXIII 261st Pope of the Roman Catholic Church

Quote: Compassion is sometimes the fatal capacity for feeling what it is like to live inside somebody else's skin. It is the knowledge that there can never really be any peace and joy for me until there is peace and joy finally for you too.
Author: Frederick Buechner educator, writer, theologian

Quote: As man draws nearer to the stars, why should he not also draw nearer to his neighbor?
Author: Lyndon B. Johnson 36th U.S. President

Quote: The value of compassion cannot be over-emphasized. Anyone can criticize. It takes a true believer to be compassionate. No greater burden can be borne by an individual than to know no one cares or understands.
Author: Arthur H. Stainback Author

Quote: No one's head aches when he is comforting another.
Author: Indian Proverb

Quote: No one is more cherished in this world than someone who lightens the burden of another.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Life has meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
Author: Antoine de Sainte-Exupery (1900-1944); aviator, writer

Quote: Diversity is the one true thing we all have in common. Celebrate it every day.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The wise man belongs to all countries, for the home of a great soul is the whole world.
Author: Democritus Greek Philosopher

Quote: Only he can understand what a farm is, what a country is, who shall have sacrificed part of himself to his farm or country, fought to save it, struggled to make it beautiful. Only then will the love of farm or country fill his heart.
Author: Antoine de Sainte-Exupery (1900-1944); aviator, writer

Quote: I am a part of all that I have met.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson Poet Laureate of Great Britain

Quote: We learn more by looking for the answer to a question and not finding it than we do from learning the answer itself.
Author: Lloyd Alexander Author

Quote: Whatever I have tried to do in life, I have tried with all my heart to do it well; whatever I have devoted myself to, I have devoted myself completely; in great aims and in small I have always thoroughly been in earnest.
Author: Charles Dickens novelist

Quote: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.\n
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson Philosopher, Poet, Author, Essayist

Quote: All the so-called "secrets of success" will not work unless you do.
Author: Unknown

Quote: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.\n
Author: Thomas Jefferson 3rd U.S. President

Quote: Work is either fun or drudgery. It depends on your attitude. I like fun.
Author: Colleen C. Barrett President and CEO, Southwest Airlines Company

Quote: Strive to be first: first to nod, first to smile, first to compliment, and first to forgive.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Open your heart - open it wide; someone is standing outside.
Author: Mary Engelbreit Artist, entrepreneur

Quote: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips it's turn.
Author: Hal Borland memoirist, author

Quote: Were it not for hope the heart would break.
Author: Scottish Proverb

Quote: We either make ourselves miserable or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
Author: Carlos Casteneda Author, philospher

Quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
Author: Thomas Paine scholar, intellectual, writer

Quote: Nothing is so strong as gentleness. Nothing is so gentle as real strength.
Author: Saint Francis de Sales Roman Catholic saint

Quote: To sit patiently with a yearning that has not yet been fulfilled, and to trust that, that fulfillment will come, is quite possibly one of the most powerful "magic skills" that human beings are capable of. It has been noted by almost every ancient wisdom tradition.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert author

Quote: Still round the corner there may wait, A new road or a secret gate.\n
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien Writer, Poet, Philologist, University Professor

Quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier, not that the task itself has become easier, but that our ability to perform it has improved.\n
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson Philosopher, Poet, Author, Essayist

Quote: Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
Author: Plato classical Greek philosopher, mathematician

Quote: Live with intention. Walk to the edge. Listen hard. Practice wellness. Play with abandon. Laugh. Choose with no regret. Appreciate your friends. Continue to learn. Do what you love. Live as if this is all there is.
Author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Quote: Better keep yourself clean and bright. You are the window through which you must see the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw playwright, Nobel Prize winner

Quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
Author: Charles Swindoll Founder of Insight for Living

Quote: No amount of ability is of the slightest avail without honor.
Author: Andrew Carnegie Industrialist, businessman, philanthropist

Quote: In great matters men show themselves as they wish to be seen; in small matters, as they are.
Author: Gamaliel Bradford Biographer, critic, poet and dramatist

Quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
Author: David Star Jordan Educator, author, peace activist

Quote: Just go out there and do what you've got to do.
Author: Martina Navr\xe1tilov\xe1 Chzec-American tennis player

Quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
Author: Ralph W. Sockman Pastor, speaker, author

Quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson Philosopher, Poet, Author, Essayist

Quote: If you think you are too small to be effective, you have never been in the dark with a mosquito.\n
Author: Unknown

Quote: It is common sense to take a method and try it. If it fails, admit it frankly and try another. But above all, try something.\n
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt 32nd U.S. President

Quote: There are souls in this world which have the gift of finding joy everywhere and of leaving it behind them when they go.
Author: Fredrick Faber Theologian and hymn composer

Quote: The best things in life are never rationed. Friendship, loyalty, love, do not require coupons.
Author: George T. Hewitt Historian

Quote: It is better to be faithful than famous.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt 26th U.S. President

Quote: We are all in the same boat in a stormy sea, and we owe each other a terrible loyalty.
Author: G. K. Chesterton writer, poet, essayist, novelist

Quote: Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead.\n
Author: Louisa May Alcott novelist

Quote: 'Stay' is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary.\n
Author: Louisa May Alcott novelist

Quote: There is nothing we like to see so much as the gleam of pleasure in a person's eye when he feels that we have sympathized with him, understood him. At these moments something fine and spiritual passes between two friends. These are the moments worth living.\n
Author: Don Marquis author, humorist

Quote: The heart may be broken, and the soul remain unshaken.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte Emperor of France

Quote: I will offer a choice, not an echo.
Author: Barry M. Goldwater Former US Senator of Arizona, presidential candidate, 1964

Quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
Author: Zora Neale Hurst Author, folkloreist

Quote: Who, being loved, is poor?
Author: Oscar Wilde novelist, playwright

Quote: For happiness is anyone and anything at all that's loved by you.
Author: Charlie Brown Character in comic strip Peanuts by Charles M. Schulz

Quote: We're here for a reason. I believe a bit of the reason is to throw little torches out to lead people through the dark.
Author: Whoopi Goldberg actress, radio host, author, comedian

Quote: It is in the shelter of each other that the people live.
Author: Irish Proverb

Quote: It takes two wings to fly.
Author: Eric Schaub Doctor, author

Quote: Men exist for the sake of one another. Teach them then or bear with them.
Author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Roman Emperor 161-180

Quote: What do we live for; if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?\n
Author: Mary Ann Evans [George Eliot] Novelist

Quote: Water continually dropping will wear hard rocks hollow.
Author: Plutarch historian, writer

Quote: Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard.
Author: Anne Sexton Poet, writer

Quote: How long should you try? Until.\n
Author: Jim Rohn entrepreneur, author, motivational speaker

Quote: The difference between try and triumph is a little umph.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Enthusiasm is the mother of effort, and without it nothing great was ever achieved.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson Philosopher, Poet, Author, Essayist

Quote: There are no traffic jams along the extra mile.
Author: Roger Staubach athlete

Quote: Whoever said anybody has a right to give up?\n
Author: Marian Wright Edelman Activist, president and founder of Children's Defense Fund

Quote: He who is devoid of the power to forgive, is devoid of the power to love.\n
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr. minister, civil rights activist

Quote: Those who wish to sing, always find a song.
Author: Swedish Proverb

Quote: Man is so made that when anything fires his soul, impossibilities vanish.
Author: Jean de La Fontaine author, fabulist

Quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.
Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer pastor, theologian, German Resistance fighter in World War II

Quote: Perhaps the most important thing we can undertake toward the reduction of fear is to make it easier for people to accept themselves, to like themselves.
Author: Bonaro W. Overstreet Author

Quote: Few things can help an individual more than to place responsibility on him, and to let him know that you trust him.\n
Author: Booker T. Washington American political leader, author

Quote: The greatest power is often simple patience.
Author: E. Joseph Cossman Author

Quote: Look at what you've got and make the best of it. It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
Author: Proverb

Quote: The last of the human freedoms is to choose one's attitudes.
Author: Viktor Frankl neurologist, psychotherapist

Quote: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
Author: Carl Sandburg poet, historian, novelist

Quote: If you can't fly then run, if you can't run then walk, if you can't walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr. minister, civil rights activist

Quote: The creative is the place where no one else has ever been. You have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition.
Author: Alan Alda actor, director, screenwriter

Quote: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
Author: Scott Adams creator of Dilbert Comic Strip

Quote: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
Author: Erich Seligmann Fromm social psychologist

Quote: I am the me I choose to be.
Author: Sir Sidney Poitier Bahamian-American actor

Quote: Creative people do not see things for what they are; they see them for what they can be.
Author: Julie Israel Writer

Quote: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
Author: Bernard Williams moral philosopher

Quote: Hope is a state of mind, not of the world. Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well\u2026, but rather an ability to work for something because it is good.
Author: Vaclav Havel poet, playwright, 1st president of Czech Republic

Quote: Just as one cannot live without dreams, one cannot live without hope. If dreams reflect the past, hope summons the future.
Author: Elie Wiesel writer, humanitarian

Quote: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt 32nd U.S. President

Quote: A highly developed values system is like a compass. It serves as a guide to point you in the right direction when you are lost.
Author: Idowu Koyenikan author

Quote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering 'it will be happier'...
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson Poet Laureate of Great Britain

Quote: What greater thing is there for human souls than to feel that they are joined for life - to be with each other in silent unspeakable memories.
Author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans] novelist, editor

Quote: It didn\u2019t matter how big our house was; it mattered that there was love in it.
Author: Peter Buffett musician, composer, author, philanthropist

Quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof.
Author: Richard David Bach writer

Quote: Having somewhere to go is home, having someone to love is family, having both is blessing.
Author: Unknown

Quote: This is my wish for you: peace of mind, prosperity through the year, happiness that multiplies, health for you and yours, fun around every corner, energy to chase your dreams, joy to fill your holidays!
Author: D.M. Dellinger

Quote: Laughing cheerfulness throws the light of day on all the paths of life.
Author: Jean Paul writer

Quote: After every storm the sun will smile; for every problem there is a solution, and the soul's indefeasible duty is to be of good cheer.
Author: William R. Alger Author, religious leader

Quote: I say to myself that I shall try to make my life like an open fireplace, so that people may be warmed and cheered by it and so go out themselves to warm and cheer.
Author: George Matthew Adams American newspaper columnist

Quote: The unselfish effort to bring cheer to others will be the beginning of a happier life for ourselves.
Author: Helen Keller author, lecturer, activist

Quote: Just don\u2019t give up trying what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don\u2019t think you can go wrong.
Author: Ella Jane Fitzgerald Jazz vocalist

Quote: I have found that among its other benefits, giving liberates the soul of the giver.
Author: Maya Angelou Poet, dancer, producer, playwright, director, author

Quote: If you have much, give of your wealth; if you have little, give of your heart.
Author: Arabic Proverb

Quote: Remember that the happiest people are not those getting more, but those giving more.
Author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr. writer

Quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but to reveal to them their own.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

Quote: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.
Author: Paulo Coelho poet, writer

Quote: The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do.
Author: Kobe Bryant Professional basketball player

Quote: Bad things do happen; how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness... or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have\u2014life itself.
Author: Walter Anderson American artist

Quote: Show me someone who has done something worthwhile, and I\u2019ll show you someone who has overcome adversity.
Author: Louis "Lou" Holtz American football coach

Quote: It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it.
Author: Lena Horne Singer, actress, civil rights activist

Quote: Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.
Author: C.S. Lewis writer, theologian, scholar

Quote: Giving is not just about making a donation, it's about making a difference.
Author: Kathy Calvin former President of the United Nations Foundation

Quote: Two kinds of gratitude: the sudden kind we feel for what we take; the larger kind we feel for what we give.
Author: Edwin Arlington Robinson Poet

Quote: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
Author: William Arthur Ward author, educator, motivational speaker

Quote: It's a funny thing about life, once you begin to take note of the things you are grateful for, you begin to lose sight of the things that you lack.
Author: Germany Kent Journalist, author

Quote: Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
Author: Marcel Proust novelist

Quote: Humility isn't denying your strengths; it's being honest about your weaknesses.
Author: Rick Warren religious leader

Quote: I claim to be a simple individual liable to err like any other fellow mortal. I own, however, that I have humility enough to confess my errors and to retrace my steps.
Author: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi Indian political and spiritual leader

Quote: Humility is the ability to give up your pride and still retain your dignity.
Author: Vanna Bonta writer, actress

Quote: There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.
Author: Henry van Dyke author, educator, clergyman

Quote: Your ambition should be to get as much life out of living as you possibly can, as much enjoyment, as much interest, as much experience, as much understanding. Not simply be what is generally called a \u2018success.\u2019
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt U.S. First Lady, diplomat, human rights activist

Quote: Ambition is enthusiasm with a purpose.
Author: Frank Tyger

Quote: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
Author: Dr. Wayne Dyer author, speaker

Quote: Ambition, fueled by compassion, wisdom and integrity, is a powerful force for good that will turn the wheels of industry and open the doors of opportunity for you and countless others.
Author: Zig Ziglar motivational author, speaker

Quote: When your ambition is greater than your fear, your life will get bigger than your dream.
Author: Farshad Asl author, entrepreneur, motivational coach

Quote: The strongest trust is built by the smallest actions, the keeping of the little promises.
Author: Walter Wangerin Jr. author

Quote: You don\u2019t earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day-by-day.
Author: Jeffrey Gitomer Author

Quote: Loyalty is the pledge of truth to oneself and others.
Author: Ada Velez-Boardley Author

Quote: No more important duty can be urged upon those who are entering the great theater of life than simple loyalty to their best convictions.
Author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin Universalist minister, author

Quote: You cannot buy loyalty; you cannot buy the devotion of hearts, minds, and souls. You have to earn these things.
Author: Clarence Francis Business executive

Quote: Grit is that \u2018extra something\u2019 that separates the most successful people from the rest. It\u2019s the passion, perseverance, and stamina that we must channel in order to stick with our dreams until they become a reality.
Author: Dr. Travis Bradberry author

Quote: Grit is the grain of character.
Author: Edwin Percy Whipple essayist

Quote: We like to think of our champions and idols as superheroes who were born different from us. We don\u2019t like to think of them as relatively ordinary people who made themselves extraordinary.
Author: Carol Dweck psychologist

Quote: Ultimately, we have just one moral duty: to reclaim large areas of peace in ourselves\u2026,and to reflect it towards others. And the more peace there is in us, the more peace there will be in our troubled world.
Author: Etty Hillesum writer

Quote: The same boiling water that softens the potato hardens the egg. It's about what you're made of, not the circumstances.
Author: Unknown

Quote: What we accomplish in the marathon of life depends tremendously on our grit\u2014our passion and perseverance for long-term goals.
Author: Dr. Angela Lee Duckworth psychologist

Quote: I don\u2019t like to gamble, but if there\u2019s one thing I\u2019m willing to bet on, it\u2019s myself.
Author: Beyonc\xe9 Knowles-Carter Singer-songwriter

Quote: Put all excuses aside and remember this: You are capable.
Author: Zig Ziglar motivational author, speaker

Quote: It is tenderness for the past, courage for the present, hope for the future.  It is a fervent wish that every cup may overflow with blessings rich and eternal, and that every path may lead to peace.
Author: Agnes M. Pharo Artist, writer

Quote: Use your voice for kindness, your ears for compassion, your hands for charity, your mind for truth, and your heart for love.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Fear grows out of the things we think; it lives in our minds. Compassion grows out of the things we are, and lives in our hearts.
Author: Barbara Garrison author

Quote: Our human compassion binds us the one to the other - not in pity or patronizingly, but as human beings who have learnt how to turn our common suffering into hope for the future.
Author: Nelson Mandela Former president of South Africa

Quote: True compassion means not only feeling another's pain but also being moved to help relieve it.
Author: Daniel Goleman psychologist and science journalist

Quote: There is nobility in compassion, a beauty in empathy, a grace in forgiveness.
Author: John Connolly Author

Quote: You always gain by giving love.
Author: Reese Witherspoon Actress, producer, entrepreneur

Quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
Author: Richard David Bach writer

Quote: The big challenge is to become all that you have the possibility of becoming.
Author: Jim Rohn entrepreneur, author, motivational speaker

Quote: Just remember, when it comes to your life, you are not only the artist but the masterpiece, as well.
Author: Cleo Wade Artist, poet, activist, and author.

Quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
Author: Willie Nelson singer, songwriter, poet

Quote: Gratitude is a powerful catalyst for happiness. It\u2019s the spark that lights a fire of joy in your soul.
Author: Amy Collette Author, speaker

Quote: Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude.
Author: Henri-Fr\xe9d\xe9ric Amiel philosopher, poet, critic

Quote: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
Author: Roy T. Bennett Author

Quote: We are made to persist. That's how we find out who we are.
Author: Tobias Wolff Author

Quote: This I do know beyond any reasonable doubt. Regardless of what you are doing, if you pump long enough, hard enough and enthusiastically enough, sooner or later the effort will bring forth the reward.
Author: Zig Ziglar motivational author, speaker

Quote: Consider the postage stamp: its usefulness consists in the ability to stick to one thing till it gets there.
Author: Josh Billings [Henry Wheeler Shaw] humorist, essayist

Quote: We can\u2019t heal the world today. But we can begin with a voice of compassion, a heart of love, and an act of kindness.
Author: Mary Davis

Quote: The most essential factor is persistence\u2014the determination never to allow your energy or enthusiasm to be dampened by discouragement.
Author: James Whitcomb Riley Author

Quote: Persistence can change failure into extraordinary achievement.
Author: Matt Biondi Olympic medalist, professional swimmer

Quote: Where hope grows, miracles blossom.
Author: Elna Rae

Quote: This new day is too dear, with its hopes and invitations, to waste a moment on the yesterdays.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson An American essayist, lecturer, and poet who led the transcendentalist movement of the mid-19th century.

Quote: Hope is a passion for the possible.
Author: S\xf8ren Kierkegaard philosopher, author

Quote: Make living your life with absolute integrity and kindness your first priority.
Author: Richard Carlson Author, psychotherapist, and motivational speaker

Quote: Practice civility toward one another. Admire and emulate ethical behavior wherever you find it. Apply a rigid standard of morality to your lives; and if, periodically, you fail as you surely will, \xadadjust your lives, not the standards.
Author: Ted Koppel British-born American broadcast journalist, best known as the anchor for Nightline, from the program's inception in 1980 until 2005.

Quote: Civility is the art and act of caring for others.
Author: Deborah King An American health and wellness author and spiritual teacher.

Quote: Genuine tolerance does not mean ignoring differences as if differences made no difference. Genuine tolerance means engaging differences within a bond of civility and respect.
Author: Richard John Neuhaus Richard John Neuhaus was a prominent Christian cleric and writer.

Quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Author: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi Indian political and spiritual leader

Quote: Blessed is the season which engages the whole world in a conspiracy of love.
Author: Hamilton Wright Mabie essayist, editor

Quote: But where was I to start? The world is so vast, I shall start with the country I know best, my own. But my country is so very large. I had better start with my town. But my town too, is large. I had best start with my street. No: my home. No: my family. Never mind, I shall start with myself.
Author: Elie Wiesel writer, humanitarian

Quote: Each one of us can make a difference. Together we make a change.
Author: Barbara Mikulski Politician and social worker

Quote: In this life we cannot always do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
Author: Mother Teresa founder of the Missionaries of Charity

Quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already. We have the power to imagine better.
Author: J.K. Rowling novelist

Quote: Do things for people not because of who they are or what they do in return, but because of who you are.
Author: Harold Kushner rabbi, author

Quote: Always be a little kinder than necessary.
Author: James M. Barrie novelist, dramatist

Quote: Simple kindness may be the most vital key to the riddle of how human beings can live with each other in peace, and care properly for this planet we all share.
Author: Bo Lozoff Author, humanitarian

Quote: Extend yourself in kindness to other human beings wherever you can.
Author: Oprah Winfrey American television host, publisher

Quote: Courage. Kindness. Friendship. Character. These are the qualities that define us as human beings, and propel us, on occasion, to greatness.
Author: R.J. Palacio Author

Quote: It is our privilege and our adventure to discover our own special light.
Author: Mary Dunbar

Quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
Author: Virgil L. "Stubby" Currence American sports writer, reporter, columnist and editor.

Quote: It\u2019s not selfish to love yourself, take care of yourself, and to make your happiness a priority. It\u2019s necessary.
Author: Mandy Hale Author

Quote: When you take care of yourself, you\u2019re a better person for others. When you feel good about yourself, you treat others better.
Author: Solange Knowles Singer, songwriter, producer

Quote: Self-care is a deliberate choice to gift yourself with people, places, things, events, and opportunities that recharge our personal battery and promote whole health \u2014 body, mind, and spirit.
Author: Laurie Buchanan PhD, author

Quote: Leadership is about empathy. It is about having the ability\u2028to relate to and connect with\u2028people for the purpose of\u2028inspiring and empowering\u2028their lives.
Author: Oprah Winfrey American television host, publisher

Quote: The nature of humanity, its essence, is to feel another\u2019s pain as one\u2019s own, and to act to take that pain away. There is a nobility in compassion, a beauty in empathy, a grace in forgiveness.
Author: John Connolly Author

Quote: Empathy is the starting point for creating a community and taking action. It\u2019s the impetus for creating change.
Author: Max Carver Actor

Quote: Empathy is simply listening, holding space, withholding judgment, emotionally connecting, and communicating that incredibly healing message of \u2018you are not alone\u2019.
Author: Bren\xe9 Brown American scholar, author, and public speaker

Quote: Empathy is seeing with the eyes of another, listening with the ears of another, and feeling with the heart of another. \u2013 Alfred Adler
Author: Alfred Adler psychiatrist

Quote: The cure for anything is salt water\u2014tears, sweat, or the sea.\n\n
Author: Isak Dinesen [Karen Blixen] author

Quote: Now I know the secret of making the best persons; it is to grow in the open air and to eat and sleep with the Earth.
Author: Walt Whitman poet, humanist

Quote: Work hard at work worth doing.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt 26th U.S. President

Quote: Wilderness is not a luxury, but a necessity of the human spirit.
Author: Edward Abbey American author

Quote: Live in the sunshine, swim in the sea, drink the wild air\u2019s salubrity.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson An American essayist, lecturer, and poet who led the transcendentalist movement of the mid-19th century.

Quote: Life's most urgent question is: What are you doing for others?
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr. minister, civil rights activist

Quote: It\u2019s good to be blessed. It\u2019s better to be a blessing.
Author: Jerry Smith American football player

Quote: If you're not making someone else's life better, then you're wasting your time. Your life will become better by making other lives better.
Author: Will Smith An American actor, producer, rapper, comedian, and songwriter.

Quote: Health and cheerfulness naturally beget each other.
Author: Joseph Addison English essayist, poet, playwright and politician.

Quote: To me, good health is more than just exercise and diet. It\u2019s really a point of view and a mental attitude you have about yourself.
Author: Albert Schweitzer Philosopher, Physician, Nobel Peace Prize Winner

Quote: Exercise to be fit, not skinny.
Author: Marika Tiggeman / Mia Zaccardo Authors

Quote: It\u2019s up to you today to start making healthy choices. Not choices that are just healthy for your body, but healthy for your mind.
Author: Steve Maraboli Author

Quote: Creativity involves breaking out of established patterns in order to look at things in a different way.
Author: Edward de Bono psychologist, physician

Quote: The only limit to the height of your achievements is the reach of your dreams and your willingness to work hard for them.
Author: Michelle Obama Author, Former First Lady

Quote: Curiosity about life in all of its aspects, I think, is still the secret of great creative people.
Author: Leo Burnett Advertising executive

Quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt 32nd U.S. President

Quote: Create what sets your heart on fire and it will illuminate the path ahead.
Author: Karma Voce Designer, illustrator

Quote: Creativity is the way I share my soul with the world.
Author: Bren\xe9 Brown American scholar, author, and public speaker

Quote: Work hard, be kind, and amazing things will happen.
Author: Conan O'Brien TV host, comedian

Quote: A simple smile. That\u2019s the start of opening your heart and being compassionate to others.
Author: HH The Dalai Lama Spiritual leader and former head of state of Tibet.

Quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
Author: Mother Teresa founder of the Missionaries of Charity

Quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity.
Author: Joseph Addison English essayist, poet, playwright and politician.

Quote: Anytime we can listen to our true self and give the care it requires, we do it not only for ourselves, but for the many others whose lives we touch.
Author: Parker Palmer author, educator, and activist

Quote: When you recover or discover something that nourishes your soul and brings joy, care enough about yourself to make room for it in your life.
Author: Jean Shinoda Bolen, M.D. Psychiatrist, author
